name: 程聖倫
objective: This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the factors that drive and influence motivation in the workplace. Through a combination of theoretical frameworks, empirical research, and practical applications, students will gain insights into the complex nature of motivation and its significance in enhancing individual and organizational performance.
schedule:
week 1: 1900-1925: Biology, Behavior, and Money

week 2: 1925-1950: Dust Bowl Empiricism

week 3: 1950-1975: The Emergence of Theory

week 4: 1975-2000: The Employee is Immerised in Thought

week 5: 20th-Century Controversies

week 6-7: Needs:The Starting Point of Motivation

week 8: Personality Traits: Distal Predictors of Motivation

week 9: Mid-term

week 10-11: Values: Trans-Situational Goals

week 12-13: Cognition: Goal, Feedback, and Self-Regulation

week 14-15: Social Cognitive Theory

week 16-17: Affect/Emotion: The Employee Has Feelings, Too

week 18: Final
materials:
Course materials will be prepared by the instructor.

Optional:

Latham, G. P. (2012), Work motivation: History, theory, research, and practice. Sage
